Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown ribbed pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, interior spotted with a brown resinous substance, exterior covered with a red/brown slip and remains of eleven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.210-211)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36356) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36356)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 368 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
